doc.ContractDescription: BENTLEY SOFTWARE RENEWAL 2014
IGF::CT::IGF - ADMINISTRATIVE MODIFICATION ASSIGNING NEW DCN TO NEW FUNDING.

METHANE IS THE SECOND MOST POWERFUL GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) AFTER CARBON DIOXIDE. THE CONCENTRATION OF METHANE HAS BEEN INCREASED FROM 700 PPB IN PRE-INDUSTRIAL TIMES TO 1758-1874 PPB IN RECENT YEARS. ONE MAJOR ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE SOURCE IS THE NATURAL GAS AND OIL DEVELOPMENT, WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO 23% OF THE TOTAL ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE EMISSION IN 2012. EXTRACTIONS OF NATURAL GAS FROM UNCONVENTIONAL SOURCES, ESPECIALLY SHALE GAS, ARE A RAPIDLY GROWING DOMESTIC ENERGY SOURCE IN RECENT YEARS. HOWEVER, RECENT WORK SHOWED THAT METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS AND OIL PRODUCTION ARE UNDERESTIMATED BY THE CURRENT EMISSION INVENTORY. THUS, DEVELOPING MORE RELIABLE DATASETS ON METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IS OF GREAT SIGNIFICANCE TO UNDERSTAND THE GAP OF CURRENT ESTIMATION AND HOW THE RAPID INCREASE OF SHALE GAS EXTRACTIONS ALTER THE METHANE LEVELS IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THE PI OF THIS PROJECT, PROF. ALBERT PRESTO, IS CURRENTLY LEADING A DOE-NETL FUNDED PROJECT TO MEASURE METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS PRODUCTIONS IN THE MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH IS ONE MAJOR SHALE GAS FORMATION IN U.S. THE TEAM HAS ALREADY MEASURED OVER 30 FACILITIES. HOWEVER, SINCE METHANE EMISSIONS ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE FOR DIFFERENT FACILITIES, HOW WELL THESE SAMPLED FACILITIES REFLECT THE OVERALL METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT REMAIN UNCERTAIN. HERE WE PROPOSE TO COMPLEMENT THIS BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENT WITH THE TOP-DOWN INVERSE MODELING TO INFER METHANE EMISSIONS. THE RETRIEVED METHANE ABUNDANCE FROM SATELLITE DATA INCLUDING SCIAMACHY (2008-2012), GOSAT (2008-2014) AND TES (2008-2014)WILL FIRST BE VALIDATED WITH IN SITU MEASUREMENTS FROM NOAA S CARBONTRACKER SYSTEM (2008-2014) AND NASA S DISCOVER-AQ AIRCRAFT CAMPAIGN (2011-2013). THEN THE SATELLITE AND IN SITU METHANE MEASUREMENTS WILL BE COMBINED TO CONSTRAIN METHANE EMISSIONS WITH THE BAYESIAN INVERSION, WHICH WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH GEOS-CHEM ON THE NORTH AMERICAN SUBDOMAIN WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON MARCELLUS REGION FROM 2008 TO 2014. A PREDETERMINED A PRIORI EMISSION FIELD WILL BE IMPLEMENTED INTO GEOS-CHEM AND BE ITERATIVELY SCALED UNTIL THE MODELED METHANE CONCENTRATIONS MATCH THE REMOTE SENSING AND IN SITU OBSERVATIONS. FINALLY, WE WILL CHECK WHETHER THE BOTTOM-UP AND THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATIONS AGREE WITH EACH OTHER WITHIN ACCEPTABLE UNCERTAINTIES. TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, CURRENTLY THERE ARE VERY FEW METHANE INVERSE MODELING WORKS FOCUSING ON MARCELLUS REGION WITH A TIME PERIOD AFTER 2010. ALSO, VERY FEW WORKS CONDUCTED METHANE INVERSE MODELING WITH MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS; MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS COULD REVEAL HOW THE GROWTH OF SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT ENHANCED THE REGIONAL ATMOSPHERIC METHANE ABUNDANCE AND PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION ON INVERSE MODELING. THE COMBINATION OF THE TOP-DOWN AND BOTTOM-UP MAKES OUR RESULTS MORE RELIABLE COMPARED WITH WORKS THAT ONLY USE ONE METHOD. THE UNCERTAINTIES OF THE BOTTOM-UP INVENTORIES CAN BE NARROWED DOWN BY THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATION; AND THE SOURCE APPORTIONMENT BASED ON BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENTS CAN BE USED TO VERIFY THE SOURCE ATTRIBUTION OF THE TOP-DOWN MODELING. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL PROVIDE A BETTER ESTIMATION OF THE METHANE EMISSION RATES FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IN MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH WILL ALSO PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING ON THE CHANGE OF THE METHANE BURDEN IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THIS IS ALIGNED WELL WITH THE NASA S GOAL OF UNDERSTANDING THE CHANGING OF ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION. ON THE POLICY PERSPECTIVE, SINCE NATURAL GAS HAS BEEN CONSIDERED AS BRIDGE FUEL BECAUSE IT EMITS LESS CO2 THAN OTHER FOSSIL FUELS DURING COMBUSTION, YET TOO MUCH METHANE EMISSIONS MAY OFFSET THIS BENEFIT, A BETTER ESTIMATION OF MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS IS ALSO IMPORTANT TO JUSTIFY THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHALE GAS. MOREOVER, THE PROPOSED WORK WILL VALIDATE NASA S SATELLITE DATA (TES) AND WILL ALSO USE DATA FROM NASA S SATELLITE (TES) AND NASA S FILED CAMPAIGN (DISCOVER-AQ) TO IDENTIFY LOCAL METHANE SOURCES
doc.MajorAgency: CONSTRAINING MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS WIT
doc.MajorFundingAgency: CONSTRAINING MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS WIT

doc.ContractDescription: SAGLOBAL ATMOSPHERIC MIXING RATIOS OF CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) HAVE INCREASED BY 36% IN THE LAST 250 YEARS, WITH HALF OF THIS RISE OCCURRING IN THE LAST FOUR DECADES. THE AVERAGE RATE OF INCREASE DURING THIS TIME HAS BEEN APPROXIMATELY 1.4 PARTS PER MILLION (PPM) PER YEAR. BECAUSE THE NORTH AMERICAN TERRESTRIAL BIOSPHERE ACTS AS A SINK FOR ATMOSPHERIC CO2, IT IS IMPORTANT TO DETERMINE ITS SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION AND QUANTIFY ITS MAGNITUDE. TERRESTRIAL SOURCES AND SINKS MAY BE ESTIMATED USING THE ATMOSPHERIC INVERSE METHOD WHEREIN ATMOSPHERIC TRANSPORT MODELS USE PRIOR CARBON FLUXES AND THEN ADJUST THEM TO BE CONSISTENT WITH OBSERVATIONS. RUNNING REANALYZED METEOROLOGY BACKWARDS IN TIME EFFECTIVELY RELATES ATMOSPHERIC CONCENTRATIONS OF CO2 TO SURFACE FLUXES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE DETECTED CONCENTRATIONS. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO APPLY THE INVERSION METHOD TO DEVELOP AN ATMOSPHERIC INVERSE FLUX ESTIMATE OF TERRESTRIAL CARBON FLUXES THROUGHOUT THE INTEGRATED COLUMN OVER NORTH AMERICA FROM 2008-2014. THIS CONTINENTAL-SCALE INVERSION WILL BE NOVEL AND IMPORTANT FOR SEVERAL REASONS. FIRST, IT WILL INCORPORATE THE EXTENSIVE ADDITIONS TO THE OBSERVATIONAL TOWER NETWORK OVER THE CONTINENT DURING THE LAST DECADE. GREATER SPATIAL DATA DENSITY ALLOWS FOR MORE ACCURATE INVERSION CARBON FLUX ESTIMATES. SECOND, IT WILL USE THE MESOSCALE WEATHER AND RESEARCH FORECASTING (WRF) MODEL AT 30 X 30 KM GRID SPACING, ALLOWING FOR MUCH FINER SIMULATION OF ATMOSPHERIC DYNAMICS OVER THE DOMAIN THAN THE GLOBAL MODELS USED IN MANY PREVIOUS STUDIES. THIS RESOLUTION FACILITATES MORE ACCURATE REPRESENTATION OF SYNOPTIC EVENTS AND THEIR INFLUENCE ON ATMOSPHERIC CO2 TRANSPORT, SUCH AS BETTER REPRESENTATION OF VERTICAL MIXING. THIRD, THE MODEL SCHEME IS FLEXIBLE TO VARIED BOUNDARY CONDITIONS, TRANSPORT REPRESENTATIONS, AND SURFACE FLUX PRIOR INPUTS. I WILL EXAMINE HOW INVERSE ESTIMATES OF INTEGRATED COLUMN CO2 OVER NORTH AMERICA CHANGES WITH EACH OF THESE COMPONENTS TO DEVELOP A RANGE OF POTENTIAL ESTIMATE UNCERTAINTY. MY FIRST OBJECTIVE IS TO EXAMINE HOW WELL THE MODEL CAPTURES INTERANNUAL VARIATION IN CLIMATE CONDITIONS AND CARBON FLUXES CAUSED BY THESE CLIMATE VARIATIONS AND THEIR IMPACT ON THE NORTH AMERICAN TERRESTRIAL BIOSPHERE. SUCH VARIATION INCLUDES SHIFTS IN THE START AND END DATES OF THE GROWING SEASON, AS WELL AS ITS DURATION. FLOODS AND DROUGHTS ARE REPRESENTED IN THIS TIME FRAME AND MODEL SIMULATION OF THE RESULTING CARBON FLUXES WILL BE EVALUATED INTERANNUALLY AND ON THE CONTINENTAL SCALE FOR THE FIRST TIME. THE ORBITING CARBON OBSERVATORY (OCO)-2, SCHEDULED FOR LAUNCH THIS JULY, WILL MAKE GLOBAL MEASUREMENTS OF CO2, PROVIDING ATMOSPHERIC CO2 DRY AIR COLUMN MOLE FRACTIONS. THESE DATA WILL REQUIRE EVALUATION AND AS SUCH, MY SECOND OBJECTIVE IS TO COMPARE THESE PRECISE MEASUREMENTS TO MY INVERSION RESULTS TO EVALUATE SPATIAL, TEMPORAL, AND VERTICAL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THEM.

doc.MajorFundingAgency: MULTIYEAR ATMOSPHERIC INVERSION FOR NORTH AMERICAN

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE A K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147. LONG THOUGHT TO BE AN ASTERISM, WE HAVE RECENTLY DEMONSTRATED THAT IT IS ACTUALLY THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR CLUSTER, WITH AN AGE OF 3 GYR AT A DISTANCE OF 300 PC (CURTIS ET AL. 2013, AJ, 145, 134). FOR COMPARISON, THE STARS IN THE SIMILARLY AGED KEPLER OPEN CLUSTER NGC 6819 ARE APPROXIMATELY 70 TIMES FAINTER, AND THOSE IN THE CLASSIC OLD BENCHMARK M67 ARE NEARLY 10 TIMES FAINTER. THIS PROXIMITY HAS ALLOWED US TO OBTAIN HIGH-RESOLUTION SPECTRA FOR NEARLY THE ENTIRE MEMBERSHIP, ENABLING STUDIES OF CHROMOSPHERIC ACTIVITY, LITHIUM DEPLETION, AND DETAILED STELLAR CHARACTERIZATIONS; OUR AO IMAGING RESOLVES BINARIES WITH ONLY 50 AU SEPARATIONS; WE CAN SPECTROSCOPICALLY IDENTIFY AND CHARACTERIZE THE WHITE DWARFS AND RED DWARFS; AND WE CAN MEASURE CORONAL X-RAY LUMINOSITIES FROM SUN-LIKE STARS DOWN TO THE EARLY K DWARFS WITH CHANDRA DATA IN-HAND. RUPRECHT 147 IS LOCATED IN SAGITTARIUS, AND SAT JUST BEYOND THE EDGE OF THE PROPOSED FIELD FOR K2 CAMPAIGN 7, UNTIL WE SUCCESSFULLY LED A PETITION FOR A POINTING ADJUSTMENT TO ACCOMMODATE THE CLUSTER. OUR PROPOSED K2 SURVEY WILL PROVIDE ASTEROSEISMIC DATA FOR THE UPPER MAIN SEQUENCE TURNOFF AND EVOLVED STARS. THIS WILL YIELD AN INDEPENDENT AGE CONSTRAINT FOR THIS UNIQUE BENCHMARK CLUSTER, BASED ON THE STELLAR MASSES DERIVED FOR THE RED GIANT BRANCH. WE WILL MEASURE ROTATION PERIODS FOR 3 GYR FGKM DWARFS. THESE DATA ARE SORELY NEEDED FOR GYROCHRONOLOGY CALIBRATION, AND WILL DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY OF STELLAR SPIN DOWN TO DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN 2.5 GYR (NGC 6819 KEPLER PRIME), 3 GYR (R147) AND 4 GYR (M67 CAMPAIGN 5) AGES (MEIBOM ET AL. 2015, NATURE). R147S PROXIMITY ALLOWS K2 TO PROVIDE HIGHER QUALITY DATA FOR MEMBERS OF MUCH LOWER MASS THAN FOR THE DISTANT NGC 6819. PAIRING THESE ROTATION PERIODS WITH OUR CHROMOSPHERIC AND CORONAL X-RAY DATA WILL PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE VIEW OF ANGULAR MOMENTUM AND MAGNETIC DYNAMO EVOLUTION AT 3 GYR. THE 8-HOUR PHOTOMETRIC VARIABILITY SIGNAL KNOWN AS FLICKER, KNOWN TO TRACE STELLAR DENSITY AND SURFACE GRAVITY, IS ALSO DETECTABLE IN K2 LIGHT CURVES (BASTIEN ET AL. 2013, NATURE, 500, 427). WE WILL CONSTRUCT A COLOR-FLICKER DIAGRAM FOR R147, WHICH WILL (1) TEST IF K2 FLICKER MEASUREMENTS PROPERLY ORDER THE CLUSTER SEQUENCE, AND THEREFORE PRODUCE ACCURATE RELATIVE GRAVITIES, (2) POTENTIALLY OFFER FLICKER CALIBRATION FOR LOWER MASS STARS LACKING SEISMIC CALIBRATION, AND (3) TEST SIGNAL-TO-NOISE DEPENDENCE, IN COMPARISON TO A SIMILAR COLORFLICKER DIAGRAM ASSEMBLED FOR M67 FROM CAMPAIGN 5. CALIBRATING AND VALIDATING K2 FLICKER WILL HAVE BROAD IMPACT FOR THE ENTIRE K2 MISSION. FINALLY, ALL 1200 ASTROMETRIC-PHOTOMETRIC MEMBERS WILL BE SURVEYED FOR STELLAR AND EXOPLANETARY TRANSITS. IF ANY LOW MASS ECLIPSING BINARIES ARE DISCOVERED, THEY COULD BECOME IMPORTANT TOUCHSTONES BECAUSE WE ALSO KNOW THEIR AGES AND COMPOSITIONS. K2 IS SENSITIVE TO 2 EARTH RADIUS EXOPLANETS AROUND FGKM DWARFS IN R147.
doc.MajorAgency: K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147 - THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: K2 SURVEY OF RUPRECHT 147 - THE OLDEST NEARBY STAR

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE TO CONTINUE THE HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL PROGRAM TO USE SWIFT TO PERFORM LOCALIZATION OF GALACTIC X-RAY TRANSIENTS NEWLY DISCOVERED BY MAXI. MAXI SCANS ALMOST THE ENTIRE X-RAY SKY EVERY ~91 MINUTES, WITH A SOURCE DETECTION SENSITIVITY OF ~60 MCRAB IN ONE ORBIT AND ~15 MCRAB IN ONE DAY, DISCOVERING X-RAY TRANSIENTS WITH 0.1-0.5 DEGREE ACCURACIES IN THE 0.5-20 KEV ENERGY BAND. SWIFT IS ABLE TO PROVIDE RAPID FOLLOW-UP OBSERVATIONS OF MAXI TRIGGERS AND LOCALIZATION<3.5 ARC-SECOND ERROR RADIUS, WHICH IS VITAL FOR IDENTIFYING ANY OPTICAL/RADIO COUNTERPART. XRT OBSERVATIONS WILL ALSO PROVIDE MEASUREMENTS OF THE LOW ENERGY X-RAY SPECTRA. UVOT WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE ASTROMETRIC CORRECTIONS, AND TO SEARCH FOR ANY OPTICAL COUNTERPARTS. SWIFT IS PROVEN TO BE UNIQUELY CAPABLE IN THIS TASK.
doc.MajorAgency: SWIFT LOCALIZATION OF MAXI DISCOVERED GALACTIC X-R
doc.MajorFundingAgency: SWIFT LOCALIZATION OF MAXI DISCOVERED GALACTIC X-R

doc.ContractDescription: THE MASS EXTINCTION AT THE CRETACEOUS/PALEOGENE (K/PG) BOUNDARY HAD A DRASTIC IMPACT ON MARINE ECOSYSTEMS. A CONSIDERABLE BODY OF EVIDENCE SUPPORTS THE IMPACT AT CHICXULUB AS THE ULTIMATE TRIGGER OF THE MASS EXTINCTION, BUT THE DYNAMICS OF THE SUBSEQUENT RECOVERY ARE STILL NOT ENTIRELY UNDERSTOOD. THE DOMINANT SKELETONIZED PHYTOPLANKTON GROUPS AT THIS TIME INCLUDE THE CALCAREOUS NANNOPLANKTON, DINOFLAGELLATES AND DIATOMS. THE CALCAREOUS NANNOPLANKTON WERE DECIMATED WITH APPROXIMATELY 85% OF GENERA AND 93% OF SPECIES GOING EXTINCT. HOWEVER, DIATOMS HAD ~85% SURVIVAL ACROSS THE BOUNDARY AND DINOFLAGELLATES ACTUALLY INCREASED IN DIVERSITY. THESE NON-CALCAREOUS PLANKTON MOST LIKELY SURVIVED BECAUSE OF THEIR ABILITY TO FORM STRESS-RESISTANT RESTING CYSTS AND BECAUSE THEY WERE BETTER ADAPTED TO HIGH-STRESS ENVIRONMENTS. AS PART OF EXOBIOLOGY GRANT NNX07AK62 A LARGE, GLOBAL DATABASE OF NANNOPLANKTON ASSEMBLAGES ACROSS THE K/PG BOUNDARY WAS COMPILED LEADING TO THE DISCOVERY THAT THE NORTHERN HEMISPHERE OCEANS SUFFERED HIGHER NANNOPLANKTON EXTINCTION RATES THAN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE WITH AN ECOLOGICAL "CRISIS" THAT LASTED FOR APPROXIMATELY 350 THOUSAND YEARS AFTER THE IMPACT. HOWEVER, NO STUDY HAS COMBINED ALL OF THE SKELETONIZED PLANKTON INTO A SINGLE INVESTIGATION TO DETERMINE HOW NON-CALCAREOUS PLANKTON INFLUENCED THE OCEANIC RECOVERY. THIS STUDY IS DESIGNED TO ASSESS HOW DIATOM, DINOFLAGELLATES AND NANNOPLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS, ESPECIALLY THOSE ON SHELVES, WERE ADAPTED TO SURVIVAL AT THE K/PG BOUNDARY. THIS INVESTIGATION WILL DETERMINE WHETHER SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF ENVIRONMENTS OFFERED REFUGES TO PHYTOPLANKTON TAXA IN THE IMMEDIATE WAKE OF THE IMPACT, WHETHER THESE ENVIRONMENTS "SEEDED" ASSEMBLAGES DURING THE RECOVERY INTERVAL, AND WHAT THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN DIATOMS, DINOFLAGELLATES AND NANNOPLANKTON TELLS US ABOUT KILLING MECHANISMS AS WELL AS THE DYNAMICS OF THE RECOVERY. ECOLOGICAL RECOVERY OF ALL PHYTOPLANKTON GROUPS LIKELY TOOK PLACE ONLY AFTER THE BIOLOGIC PUMP WAS RESTORED AFTER THE K/PG EXTINCTION. THE PROPOSED STUDY IS ALSO DESIGNED TO REFINE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE RECOVERY OF THE BIOLOGICAL PUMP CONTROLLED THE RECOVERY OF PHYTOPLANKTON ECOSYSTEMS. NANNOPLANKTON ASSEMBLAGES WILL BE STUDIED IN SELECTED NORTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF SECTIONS AND IN MORE NUMEROUS SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF AND DEEP-SEA SECTIONS. INVESTIGATION OF NANNOPLANKTON WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WHEREVER POSSIBLE WITH DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES: DIATOMS IN SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF SECTIONS AND DINOFLAGELLATES IN NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELVES AND SLOPE DEPOSITS. IT IS HYPOTHESIZED THAT DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES MAY HAVE HELPED (VIA REMOVAL OF EXCESS NUTRIENTS AND METALS) OR HINDERED (VIA COMPETITION) THE RECOVERY OF NANNOPLANKTON. WE HAVE THE FOLLOWING PRIMARY HYPOTHESES TO EXPLAIN THE NATURE OF THE RECOVERY: 1. EARLIEST PALEOCENE NANNOPLANKTON ORIGINATED IN THE SHELF ENVIRONMENTS AND SPREAD THROUGH THE OCEAN AFTER THE K/PG EVENT; 2. THE SHELVES OFFERED A REFUGE FOR NANNOPLANKTON AT THE BOUNDARY, AND OTHER PLANKTON GROUPS (DIATOMS AND DINOFLAGELLATES) COULD HAVE EITHER HELPED OR HINDERED THE NANNOPLANKTON RECOVERY; 3. THE BIOLOGICAL PUMP PAVED THE WAY FOR SITES TO BECOME HABITABLE BY REMOVING TOXIC METALS AND EXCESS NUTRIENTS FROM THE SURFACE OCEAN; AND 4. SURFACE ACIDIFICATION WAS NOT SEVERE ENOUGH TO CAUSE EXTINCTION, BUT METAL POISONING AMPLIFIED EXTINCTION AND PROLONGED RECOVERY. DEVELOPMENT OF A HIGH-RESOLUTION STRATIGRAPHIC FRAMEWORK IN THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE SHELF AND SLOPE LOCATIONS AND AT SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE DEEP-SEA SITES WILL BE THE CORNERSTONE OF THE INVESTIGATION.
